resource.chars:
<u>The Stomach.<\u>
The stomach of both the larva and imago contains 
glandular follicles, and these secrete a digestive fluid 
which answers in every way to that of the Vertebrate 
pancreas. This conclusion has been arrived at by 
the following experiments:-
(a) A small portion of the stomach was placed on 
starch paste. The starch granules disappeared, with 
the exception of the celluloid covering, and on 
treating with water, and testing the solution with 
Fehling’s solution, sugar in the dextrose form was 
found.
It may be remarked that according to Jousset de 
Bellesme* the secretion of the salivary glands of <u>Peri-
planeta (Blatta) orientalis <\u> is alone able to convert 
starch into dextrose. The investigations described 
in this paper do not confirm this statement 
; neither 
* Jousset de Bellesme, <u>Comptes Rendus <\u>, 1876, 1878.
